joemmo,"2015-12-22T21:30:27.353Z","A Good Microfighter with a great minifig","

As a Star Wars and Microfighters fan I'
column2: ve been looking forward to the new series and specifically the Force Awakens sets of which this is one of two. The vehicle looked fun&nbsp
column3: and the minifig is the same as featured in the full size speeder set 75100 so I grabbed a set as soon as it appeared at my local supermarket.

column1: Standard small box size with the product / action shot on the front and rear with the snowy Starkiller Base background theme tying it to the new 75125 X-Wing. The back shows the rest of the series 3 range paired up by theme with

Nothing particularly rare or exotic here and predominantly in grey and black, appropriately for the design. The main form is defined with simple angled and sloping bricks and plates but there is plenty of detail added with grill tiles,
column2: black tapered 2x2 cylinders and a couple of black lightsaber handles as guns. The front&nbsp
column3: cannon features a studshooter attached with a technic angle connector and some trans orange &#39

column1: Possibly the star of the set, it'
column2: s one of the new First Order Snowtroopers complete with backpack and&nbsp

column1: This is really a nice figure with crisp and detailed printing on torso and legs, new helmet design plus a printed 1x1 tile that attaches to the character via a neck bracket. Underneath the helmet its just the old clone face though, it would be nice to get some variety in expression and skin colour.

column2: minifigs, this comes with a regular mid sized blaster rather than the mini size.

column1: As with most sets this size it was fairly straightforward with some simple SNOT
column2: techniques used to get the front and rear end shaping, which they achieve quite&nbsp
column4: s some nice greebling detail with the sloping grill and flat 2*1 grill pieces and the trans orange studs used for jets provide a splash of colour in an otherwise grey model.

column1: I also liked the way the studshooter has been built into the front as a swiveling gun, it
column3: much more satisfying than a flick missile for play value. If you don&#39
column4: t like the stud shooter then you can fit the spare lightsaber handle instead of the green stud for a slightly more aggressive look.

column2: s a compact chunky model as befits the style, the driver/pilot sits in nicely and it just has a good playable feel to it. It sits alongside other Microfighters well and the scale, IMHO, is better than the larger Lego version which is a little bloated. This would actually fit in well with the TFA battlepacks, especially as the Resistance pack comes with a similar vehicle.

column13: > This second Microfighter for The Force Awakens represents a vehicle that was barely seen on-screen as most of it was cut from the film. The design is very nice and I find this to be one of the better offerings from the Microfighters Sub-Theme.

column8: >First Order Snowtrooper: This particular Minifigure looks awesome. Not only is the printing on the torso and legs highly detailed, but the helmet and extra 1x1 printed tile used for the backpack strikes me as pretty decently chosen to represent a character that sadly got relatively little screen time. The only flaw is the use of the Clone/Stormtrooper Head, underneath that helmet is standard Imperial and Republic era facial printing that is standard for these masked troopers. A real disappointment compared to everything else that makes this one of the best troopers I&rsquo
>The build is very short where this set is concerned. It&rsquo
column9: s a really fast and easy to follow build without any tricky parts. When it comes to the final model you&rsquo
column10: ll find that this is very cute and very army builder friendly. The design looks great and features some interesting choices. The main weapon which is a stud launcher stands out because of how it sits in the front of the speeder.

column9: t as iconic looking as the Rebel Snowspeeder
column10: however I do find this model to look like something a ship that the First Order would use. I especially like the use of the R5 Astromech head in black for side-engines, it&rsquo
column11: s actually quite rare to find from what I&rsquo
column12: ve seen, I could be mistaken. Overall a really fun model and fun to play with.

column9: d recommend getting this set. I&rsquo
column10: d even go so far as to recommend getting multiples. Most Microfighters are decent, they capture the likeness they want to without issues, when it comes to this set not only does a small army sound like genuine fun, but you can troop build First Order Snowspeeder&rsquo
